Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into four registers: 1 - Three columns of Hieroglyphic text including cartouches of Amenemhat III and IV flanked by representations of Osiris and Anubis in naoi. 2 - Two kneeling figures on the left; Two figures seated on either side of a table on the right. 3 - Three kneeling female figures with offering-tables. 4 - Two kneeling male figures with offering-tables.
Bibliographic references: Scott-Moncrieff 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 2. (pl.50)
Acquisition notes: Identified as one of two stelae in lot 292 at 1835 Salt sale, according to Leemans, Lettre a M Francois Salvolini (Leiden 1838), 42.
